reviewText: The cat universe wasn't as interesting to me as the regular Fairy Tail universe
Title: Fairy Tail: Part 9

reviewText: Fairy Tail Part 9 is the beginning of a 2 Part arc known as the "Tenrou Island" arc. Part 9 starts as most arcs do: with everyone lounging about at the guild hall. Later though, Makarov makes an appearance to the guild with an announcement: the Fairy Tail 'S-Class' promotional trials are due to begin soon. In these trials, several of the toughest members of the guild are picked- only the one who passes the trial will be promoted to an S class wizard, and be allowed to take tougher job requests. All members selected for the trial are also allowed to bring one partner along with them to aid them in the struggle.With all members and partners set, Makarov and the current S-Class wizards take a ship to Fairy Tail's sacred ground: Tenrou Island. Once arrived, each team enters a seperate tunnel on the island. Each tunnel as a difficult challange. Those include: Fighting Erza, Mirajane, Gildarts, (ouch) or face a different challange such as a mental challange.After the 1st challange is completed, the remaining contests are given their second assignment: find Fairy Tail's 1st Master's grave. Whilst looking for Mavis's grave however, one group is interrupted: two wizards from the most powerful dark guild in the world: Grimoire Heart, have landed to scout the island.With the imenent landing of the full forces of Grimoire Heart, including the all-powerful "Seven Kins of Purgatory", Fairy Tail puts the trial on hold to try and repel the overwhelming attack. With defeat nearly certain from the start, Fairy Tail needs to give all it has to defeat this threat to their sacred ground, and stop Grimoire Heart from obtaining its ultimate goal of capturing a certain LEGENDARY black wizard. Not all members will emerge victorious, let alone alive from this battle.On a personal note, this is the most action pact arc. There is more fighting in this arc than any other yet. Amazing fights go on, including my favorite fight in this part: Fire Dragon vs Flame God (episode 105). There are over 10 new intense soundtracks that are played for those of you who love Fairy Tail music (who dosn't?), and what suprised me was (small spoiler here) not all fights ended with Fairy Tail winning. In fact, MOST of them were a draw, (spolier again) or Fairy Tail lost! I think there were only 3 Fairy Tail victories in the Part 9, simply because the Seven Kins of Purgatory are SO POWERFUL.In summary, This part has LOADS of fighting, the fights are- as always, 100% intriguing and fun, and there is also some backstory material in this as you get to see why all of the wizards want S class so much. As usualy this is a 5/5 Fairy Tail that MUST be bought by anyone remotely interested. Here is a link to the official FUNimation trail on youtube incase you want a sneak peak:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0WA046q00fU
summary: Total Warfare on Fairy Tail's Most Sacred Ground
Title: Fairy Tail: Part 9

reviewText: More information is revealed about the guild and its history and some of the characters.  I thought it was a bit more intense than the previous ones.  Still contains humor.  Story line is building a lot.
Title: Fairy Tail: Part 9

reviewText: My family enjoy this series very much.  I started watching the Japanese version and fell in love with it.  When I found out that it had been dubbed into English, I had to get them!!  We have every part that has been released onto DVD and are excited to see the continuation of the series.
Title: Fairy Tail: Part 9

reviewText: The set shows us the Fairy Tail S Class rating challenge and the conflicted feelings one member of this beloved guild member must decide while on the quest.  Fairy Tail will of course face another challenge while on this journey that will give us more insight on come of the characters and what the guild truly represents.The action is fast paced and exciting as ever with the series and unlike the previous Edolas arc we have more members of this beloved guild able to prove their resolve and true strength to themselves and to their fellow guild/family members. This series both the anime and manga have replaced the rating for Naruto in my mind as the characters truly endear themselves to you better and have a relationship you wish you'd see on Naruto though it's understandable why not as well.  The animation is great and the soundtrack matches perfectly with a good tempo to math the scenes from nostalgic to action paced.I also appreciate the cast from both the Japanese and English for staying with the series as all of them have voiced their character roles very well.So for fans of the series rejoice as the newest set has finally come out for us to add to our collection and for those interested in the series  I say start with the first set while it may seem a pain it'll help you understand the characters and story much better then just starting off with this set.
summary: Just As A Lost Loved One Returns Fairy Tail Faces Another Challenge Both From Without And Within
Title: Fairy Tail: Part 9

reviewText: This series is fun. For lovers of action, and this one has with enough heart to keep you watching. I'd give it a pg13 rating for any parents out there.
Title: Fairy Tail: Part 9
